title: BBC Local Live: Northamptonshire for Wednesday 9 September 2015 - BBC News
summary: chief executive of towcester racecourse , kevin ackerman , is found guilty at a racing corruption hearing .
a postcard featuring bell end in woollaston has been censored at a women 's institute event .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on thursday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates are finished for today but we 'll be back with you tomorrow from 08:00 with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel for northamptonshire .

documents.title: northampton chronicle & echo : suspected fire at hospital confirmed as false alarm
text: reports of a fire at northampton general hospital have been confirmed as a false alarm .

documents.title: northampton town takeover meeting cancelled
text: a planned meeting regarding the takeover of northampton town has been postponed .

it is believed it would have been the first time the club , the indian consortium set to take it over and northampton borough council have met since the news broke that chairman david cardoza is planning to sell up .
the secret meeting had been due to take place this afternoon , but we have just been told it was called off as the club is instead meeting solely with the consortium .
that means the council , an interested party due to it having loaned northampton town £ 10.25m to improve its sixfields stadium , is likely to have a meeting with the consortium at a later date .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC News

documents.title: northampton mp says queen 'has crossed all party political divides '
text: the queen has thanked well-wishers at home and overseas for their `` touching messages of kindness '' as she became britain 's longest-reigning monarch .
michael ellis , conservative mp for northampton north , who helped organise a stained-glass window in parliament for her diamond jubliee , has been speaking about the achievement .
under queen victoria 's reign , which the queen has now surpassed , we see the transformation of the country between 1837 and 1901 .
but the country from the start of the queen 's reign in 1952 to today has changed in a way that could n't be fathomed in the 1950s .
she has crossed all party political divides and every facet of our society . ''
author: BBC News Channel

documents.title: evening headlines : towcester racecourse boss guilty of corruption appeal to trace 'good samaritans '
text: if you 're catching up :
author: Sarah Foster
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: evening weather : clear tonight , sunshine tomorrow
text: any cloud left this evening is tending to melt away to leave mostly clear skies .
temperatures in some rural spots will fall to 10c ( 50f ) .
tomorrow will be a fine and dry day , with plenty of sunshine although it will be quite breezy at times .
highs between 19-21c ( 66-70f ) .
author: Alina Jenkins
BBC Weather

documents.title: towcester racecourse boss will appeal against corruption verdict
text: kevin ackerman , the chief executive of towcester racecourse , has indicated he will appeal against his corruption conviction , with his lawyer describing the verdict by the british horseracing authority ( bha ) as 'fundamentally flawed ' .
although there have been cases like this before , having a racecourse chief executive found guilty of corruption is unheard of in modern times .
the bha have n't decided the punishment yet , but the minimum is a six month ban from all racecourses , meaning technically he would n't be able to walk into his office .
author: Cornelius Lysaght
BBC Sport horse racing correspondent

documents.title: northamptonshire telegraph : mp told no change on plans to re-open prison
text: an mp has been told the situation remains the same regarding wellingborough prison and there are no plans to re-open it .

documents.title: towcester racecourse boss could be banned for 10 years
text: kevin ackerman , the chief executive of towcester racecourse , could face a ban of six months to 10 years from all racecourse after he was he was found guilty at a racing corruption hearing .
ackerman laid bets against a horse knowing its jockey aimed not to win between november 2011 and march 2012 , but strenuously denied the allegations .
however , the british horseracing authority found he and three others guilty .
it has yet to decide their punishments .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: boss of towcester racecourse could be banned from all racecourses
text: kevin ackerman , towcester racecourse chief executive , was found guilty at a racing corruption hearing and could be banned from all racetracks .
mr ackerman was one of four people , including jockey michael stainton , convicted by a disciplinary panel over the running and riding of ad vitam in four races .
the towcester boss was found to have 'laid ' bets online on the horse , when ridden by mr stainton , knowing that he was not running to gain the best finishing position .
author: Cornelius Lysaght
BBC Sport horse racing correspondent

documents.title: breakingtowcester racecourse chief found guilty at racing corruption hearing
text: the chief executive of towcester racecourse , kevin ackerman , is facing the prospect of being banned from all racetracks after he was found guilty at a racing corruption hearing .

documents.title: police looking for 'good samaritans ' who may have information on sexual assault
text: police believe a man and a woman who aided a woman to a taxi rank in the early hours of the morning may have information regarding a serious sexual assault .

northamptonshire police want to trace the pair , who helped the woman in northampton town centre , between 03.45 and 04:00 , get from near nb 's bar in bridge street to a taxi rank in bradshaw street .
the alleged assault is believed to have happened in miller 's meadow , st andrew 's road , shortly before 05:00 .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: east northamptonshire council to co-ordinate offers from residents to home refugees
text: east northamptonshire council has told me it is encouraging residents who would like to offer housing to refugees to get in touch .
the council will co-ordinate any effort once it has received more advice from the government .
the move comes in the light of david cameron 's announcement the uk would take 20,000 refugees from syria over the next five years .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: visitors 'gobsmacked ' as bell end in woollaston censored at wi event
text: a northamptonshire street was one of the places deemed 'too rude ' by the women 's institute centennial fair in harrogate .
dominic greyer , who was selling merchandise for his book 'lesser spotted britain ' said ladies approaching his stall during the event at the weekend were `` gobsmacked '' .
the locations deemed 'too rude ' :

bell end , woollaston ; wetwang , east yorkshire ; cockermouth , cumbria ; three cocks , powys ; twatt , shetland islands ; sandy balls , hampshire ; slack bottom , west yorkshire ; butts view , derbyshire ; cocking , sussex ; bully hole bottom , monmouthshire ; minge lane , worcestershire ; assington , suffolk ; juggs lane , west sussex ; furry way , cornwall ; rings end , cambridgeshire
the organisers have yet to comment .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: spirit of corby awards voting opened
text: the spirit of corby awards are corby borough council 's annual event celebrating those who have made a difference in the community .
voting is available through the borough council 's website , and will close in a week .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: from little grey men to the lion , the witch and the wardrobe : what got you reading ?
text: northamptonshire 's library service is aiming to improve children 's reading .
you 've been revealing which books got your reading
let me know what your book of choice was by emailing me , or sending a tweet .
famous 5 - and the lion witch and wardrobe aged 6
northamptonshire libraries aim to get children reading well by 11 .
what book got you reading ?
@ twitterid the little grey men by 'bb ' , a northamptonshire author .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: latest headlines : appeal for two 'good samaritans ' calls for independent medical negligence body
text: here 's are our top stories this afternoon :
author: Sarah Foster
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: daventry express : mp answers social housing tenants ' questions
text: daventry mp chris heaton-harris visited the daventry & district housing offices to answer housing and welfare-related questions from staff and tenants .

documents.title: queen draws a crowd in corby
text: the queen celebrates becoming britain 's longest-reigning monarch today .
here is how crowds in corby celebrated her visit to the town for the diamond jubilee in 2012 .
author: BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: author has northamptonshire postcard censored by wi
text: bell end in woollaston was one of the place names deemed too rude to be shown at a women 's institute ( wi ) event .

dominic greyer said organisers of the wi 's centennial fair in harrogate asked him to cover up coasters , mugs and tea-towels featuring some of britain 's saucier-named towns and villages , from his book 'lesser spotted britain ' .
`` it was pretty farcical , it was like i was running an adult shop .
i had to cover up what on paper seem like rude names but , in context , are real places from around the uk .
it 's just 'carry on ' humour , it 's not like you ca n't drive past these places , they 're all out there on the street for people to see .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: applications for the northampton international academy open next week
text: pupils will be able next week to apply to the northampton international academy , the £ 30m development which is being created on the site of the old royal mail sorting office on barrack in northampton .
the school will eventually have a capacity of 2,220 pupils , but in september 2016 will take 60 pupils in the reception class and 300 students in year seven .
to see more .
of what the school might look like head to our facebook page .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: what book got you reading ?
text: with northamptonshire 's library service aiming to improve children 's reading i asked what book got your reading
let me know what your book of choice was by emailing me , or sending a tweet .
northamptonshire libraries aim to get children reading well by 11 .
what book got you reading ?
@ twitterid there were two : the phantom tollbooth by norton juster and then watership down by richard adams .
the phantom tollbooth by norton juster is my favourite all-time # book .
followed by moomins
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: today 's big lyveden new bield
text: the main image on today 's page is the unfinished elizabethan summer house lyveden new bield .
another historic house - apethorpe hall - has been in the news today , with the new owners moving in .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: the queen 's 2012 visit to corby
text: today the queen is in edinburgh on the day she becomes britain 's longest reigning monarch .
as part of the her last celebration , her diamond jubilee , she visited corby .
you can have a look at our facebook gallery from the day .
author: BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: afternoon weather : dry with sunshine
text: the rest of today will remain dry withsome spells of sunshinebreaking through the cloud , especially by the end of the afternoon .
in the sunshine it will feel pleasant with a maximum temperature of 19c ( 66f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: how will the northampton international academy look ?
text: the new northampton international academy has released a series of artist 's impressions of a school being built on the site of the former royal mail sorting office site on barrack road in northampton .
the northampton international academy will open in 2017 and plans to take 1,500 secondary pupils , 300 six form pupils and 420 additional primary pupils .
there are more on our facebook page .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: post office in brackley to close for two weeks
text: brackley 's post office is closing its doors this lunchtime for a fortnight .
it 's being upgraded to become a main post office , offering more services .
people are being advised to use facilities in nearby villages until september 25 .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: afternoon headlines : calls for medical negligence body brackley 's post office to close for two weeks
text: these are the stories we 're talking about :
author: Sarah Foster
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: northamptonshire libraries aim to get all children reading well by 11
text: read to your child for at least 10 minutes every day - that is one of the challenges being set by the county 's library service .
it 's all part of the read on geton campaign , which aims to get every child reading well by the age of 11 in 2025 .
what book got you reading as a child ?
i loved a science book called `` black holes and uncle albert , '' but found the hobbit hard work .
email us to let us know what got you reading .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: corbisiero and hartley in world cup missing xv
text: rhys webb , danny cipriani and leigh halfpenny are among the absentees from the tournament , but do they make a missing players xv ?
northampton saints players alex corbisiero and dylan hartley do .
author: The Daily Telegraph

documents.title: 'business as usual ' for queen says her county representative
text: today the queen becomes britain 's longest reigning monarch , but northamptonshire 's lord lieutenant david laing says she 'll treat the day like any other .

she 's quite something , at 89-year-old still going strong and i think 63 years and a half of looking after us all and taking our interests to heart is a major record , but it 's a working day for her , a day in the office . ''
author: BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: county 's departing england star to give away cricket awards
text: northamptonshire cricket club have announced that england all-rounder david willey will be the special guest at their county age group presentation in october .
willey , who will join yorkshire next season , is currently with the england one day squad , who are taking on australia in a five match series .
there are more details about the awards on the club 's website .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: northamptonshire telegraph : kettering to host 'spectacular ' festival
text: electronic music lovers will get the chance to experience a new festival in kettering next year after it was granted a festival licence .

documents.title: journalist jake hanrahan : 'it 's important to cover these things '
text: vice news journalist , jake hanrahan , 25 , originally from northampton , who was arrested in turkey , has said it isimportant the region is covered .
you ca n't stay away from something because there 's a possibility something bad might happen otherwise journalists might not do anything .

i think it 's important to cover these things - you know a lot of civilians have been killed - there 's a bigger issue here and we did n't just want to do it from the desk because that 's not what we do at vice news . ''
author: Sima Kotecha
Today programme

documents.title: northampton woman wants independent medical negligence body
text: i 've been speaking to a avril bandy , from northampton , who discovered the dead body of her 30-year-old son keith just hours after he was left without treatment by paramedics .
since keith 's death in 2010 the east midlands ambulance service says it 's made a number of changes and improvements .
author: Annabel Amos
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: northampton chronicle & echo : nhs charged twice for private treatment
text: a private hospital has been challenged on the accuracy of its billing after the nhs was charged twice for the treatment of several northampton patients .

documents.title: police 'swarmed car ' says journalist arrested in turkey
text: jake hanrahan , the vice news journalist , originally from northampton , has been speaking about his arrest in turkey when he was accused of working for a `` terrorist organisation '' .
hanrahan ( right ) , 25 , was detained with colleague philip pendlebury ( left ) , who has also been released , and their translator mohammed ismael rasool , who still in custody .

about 20 police officers just jumped off the steps , just swarmed the car , took us in , and searched our rooms and eventually just told us you 've been arrested for terror offences and then that night we were taken and put in solitary cells . ''
author: Sima Kotecha
Today programme

documents.title: latest headline : calls for medical negligence body apethorpe hall 'now a palace '
text: here 's what we are looking at :
author: Andrew Radd
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: northants herald & post : x factor 'alien ' talks of 'incredible experience '
text: a northampton college student in x factor girl group 'alien ' has spoken of her 'incredible ' experience on the show so far .

documents.title: apethorpe hall now called a palace and set to stage concerts
text: jean christophe baron pfetten , who bought apethorpe hall last year , has told me the jacobean mansion is to be re-named apethorpe palace due to it 's connections to james i and charles i and that he wants to stage classical concerts there .
we intend to have ballet music recitals here next year , the first in june with the world renowned philharmonic orchestra .
we are thinking about turning apethorpe into the glyndebourne of chamber music . ''
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: wilder says players may be affected by takeover talk
text: cobblers boss chris wilder told me that despite the issues with the takeover and questions from the fans the players are definitely getting paid .
but admitted some of them may be affected by rumours `` swirling '' around the club .
it 's up to the senior players to step up .
those supporters will be 100 % behind us , and they have been .
people just want clarity , because it 's a fact that it 's been going on a while and people want answers . ''
author: Joe Townsend
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: ambulance service has made 'significant changes ' since death of man left in 2010
text: in 2010 , avril bandy returned to her northampton home to find her son keith dead just hours after he was left without treatment by paramedics following a 999 call .
she is calling for an independent body to investigate case like hers .
the east midlands ambulance service said they are `` sorry for the distress experienced by the family of mr bandy after his death '' .
since 2010 , there have been a number of significant changes at emas .
we have a new trust board , and a new management team in northamptonshire with a dedicated focus to duty of candour . ''
author: BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: cobblers boss says club at it 's best when 'moving forward '
text: northampton town manager chris wilder has told me he would like the takeover and redevelopment of the east stand resolved as soon as possible .
i would like a great positive environment for the players .
the way we 're trying to play and the young players we 've got , they need that to produce their best performances .
i 've said that at every club , that when the club is moving forward the players produce their best . ''
author: Joe Townsend
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: world record attempt in corby tonight
text: to celebrate national fitness day , corby borough council 's health and fitness team is attempting to break the record for the number of people simultaneously doing sit-ups .
the record currently stands at 414 people .
the attempt will take place at corby town football club from 18:30 .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: journalist from northampton speaks about his arrest in turkey
text: a vice news journalist released last week after being arrested in turkey and accused of working for a `` terrorist organisation '' has spoken of the `` massive sense of responsibility '' he feels for his iraqi translator , who remains in custody .
jake hanrahan , 25 , originally from northampton , had been arrested with fellow journalist philip pendlebury and translator mohammed ismael rasool .
it was a traumatic experience the biggest burden right now is the fact that my friend and colleague mohammed ismael rasool is still in prison .
that is the worst possible thing . ''
author: Sima Kotecha
Today programme

documents.title: new owner for apethorpe hall finally moves in
text: jean-christophe baron pfetten , the new owner of apethorpe hall , near oundle , has finally taken up residence after buying the historic stately home at the end of last year for £ 2.5m .
ten years of restoration work will now start , including bringing water and electricity to the building and baron pfetten told me he intends to make it his home .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: calls for independent body to look at medical negligence cases
text: avril bandy , from northampton , who discovered her 30-year-old son keith dead hours after he was left without treatment by paramedics following a 999 call , has said there should be an independent body to investigate cases of medical negligence .
the family were compensated for their loss , but failed in a separate claim for the psychological damage it caused .
we were n't looking for compensation , we were looking for the truth .
we did n't want to it happen to anybody else .
we felt there was an awful lot of questions that the east midlands ambulance service did n't answer . ''
author: BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: morning headlines : calls for medical negligence body new owner for apethorpe hall
text: here are our top stories :
author: Andrew Radd
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: weather : cloudy , but spells of sunshine
text: it will be rather cloudy at first , but the cloud should gradually thin and break to allow some spells of sunshine to develop .
feeling pleasant in the sunshine with a top temperature of 19c ( 66f ) .
you can see kate kinsella 's full forecast on the bbc look east facebook page .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning and welcome to local live for northamptonshire
text: between now and 18:00 i 'll be bringing you the latest news , weather , sport and travel for northamptonshire .
if you want to get in touch then you can email me , tweet us , or head to facebook .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live
